result.execSummary:
The defendant David Lee Griffiths was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. David Lee Griffiths is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • David Lee Griffiths was found guilty of Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

from Jennifer H jh
$805.00 due in 30 days or civil judgment.

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State. Defendant, David Lee Griffiths, appeared with Attorney Michael D. Cicchini.  Clerk: PT
State is compliant with victim rights notification.  Defendant has paid the restitution in full and sentencing arguments are made.    Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample and notice is given.   Court imposes a fine of $200 plus costs & DNA surcharge.  Cash Bond on deposit is to be applied and any remaining balance of bond is to be returned to poster.   Appeal Rights given.
about change to plea hearing jh
Restitution ordered in the amount of $5000
for Restitution Order filed by ADA Trigg

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State. Defendant, David Lee Griffiths, appeared with Attorney Michael D. Cicchini.  Clerk: PT
State is compliant with victim rigthts and case is resolved.  Count 3 - DE pleads No Contest; found guilty by the court.  Counts 1, 2 and 4 - Dismissed by the State.  Atty Cicchini states parties stipulate to the restitution in the amount of $5000 and DE has paid the restitution in full today.  Restitution order is signed by the court.  Atty Cicchini requests sentencing be adjourned until the end of July to allow DE time to complete the DV program per the State's recommendation.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 28, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State.  Attorney Michael Cicchini appeared in court with DE David Griffiths.  Parties mutually request motion be held in abeyance at this time to allow further negotiation between parties.  The motion hearing is adjourned to 5/17/16 @ 2:00 p.m. Clerk S. Garcia.
